name: Md. Mosaddek Khan
content: Md Mosaddek Khan Dr. Md Mosaddek Khan Associate Professor Department of Computer Science and Engineering University of Dhaka, Bangladesh Email: mosaddek[at]du.ac.bd Web: http://www.mmkhansajeeb.com/ Profile: [Google Scholar] [DBLP] [CSAuthors] About me I am an Associate Professor at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, University of Dhaka, Bangladesh since July 2022. Before that, I served the same department as an Assistant Professor and Lecturer. I also initiate and direct a research group named Cognitive Agents and Interaction Lab at the University of Dhaka. I have received my PhD in Computer Science from the University of Southampton, UK in 2018 under the supervision of Prof. Nick Jennings CB, FREng and Dr Long Tran-Thanh. Prior to this, I have completed my MS and BSc in Computer Science and Engineering from the University of Dhaka in 2012 and 2010, respectively. During the time, I was supervised by Prof. Md. Mamun-or-Rashid. I am particularly interested in conducting research in the field of Distributed Artificial Intelligence, often recognised as Multi-Agent Systems. Specifically, my research focuses on developing distributed decision making algorithms to deal with constraints in cooperative or competitive multi-agent systems. I am also interested in developing algorithms for different real-world applications by integrating deep learning and Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning (MARL) methodologies. Recent News (Last Updated: May 2022) May'2022: Our paper titled "On evaluation of patrolling and signalling schemes to prevent poaching in green security games" published in Intelligent Systems with Applications Journal of Elsevier. February, July'2022: two papers got accepted in IEEE Access Journal. January '2022: AAMAS 2022 paper (Extended Abstract) "A Simulation Based Online Planning Algorithm for Multi-Agent Cooperative Environments" got accepted. July '2021: IEEE ISPA 2021 paper "Accelerating Message Passing Operation of GDL-Based Constraint Optimization Algorithms Using Multiprocessing" got accepted. June '2021: Received an ICT innovation grant (BDT 1.5M) to work on the deployment of Multi-Agent Deep Reinforcement Learning to solve MAPF problems. May '2021: Two AAMAS 2021 full papers: "Accelerating Recursive Partition-Based Causal Structure Learning Using An Improved Structure Refinement Approach" and "A Local Search Based Approach to Solve Continuous DCOPs" got published. October '2020: Our paper "Speeding Up Distributed Pseudo-tree Optimization Procedures with Cross Edge Consistency to Solve DCOPs" published in the Applied Intelligence journal of Springer . April '2020: Our paper titled "Learning Optimal Temperature Region for Solving Mixed Integer Functional DCOPs" accepted in IJCAI 2020. March '2020: Start directing the Cognitive Agents and Interaction Research Group at the University of Dhaka. March '2020: Received an ICT innovation grant to work on Security Games! March '2020: Started working on a project "mindFlare" with Prof. Md. Mamun-or-Rashid and his team - funded by the ICT division of Bangladesh. February '2020: AAMAS 2020 paper "AED: An Anytime Evolutionary DCOP Algorithm" got accepted. February '2020: AAMAS 2020 paper (Extended Abstract) "C-CoCoA: A Continuous Cooperative Constraint Approximation Algorithm to Solve Functional DCOPs" got accepted. November '2019: AAAI 2020 paper "A Particle Swarm Based Algorithm for Functional Distributed Constraint Optimization Problems" accepted for publication. April'2019: Joined as an Assistant Professor at the Department of CSE, University of Dhaka. May '2018: Completed my PhD in Computer Science from the University of Southampton, UK. March '2018: Our paper "Speeding Up GDL-Based Message Passing Algorithms for Large-Scale DCOPs" published in The Computer Journal of Oxford University Press. January '2018: Our paper "A Near-Optimal Node-to-Agent Mapping Heuristic for GDL-based DCOP Algorithms in Multi-Agent Systems" got accepted in AAMAS 2018. January '2018: Our paper "A Generic Domain Pruning Technique for GDL-based DCOP Algorithms in Cooperative Multi-Agent Systems got accepted in AAMAS 2018. Publications Dissertation Md.
